descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This seminar lasts all three quarters of 2016-17 for students writing a senior thesis in history. During the fall quarter the seminar meets every week to discuss how historians conduct research and to explore your own topics for research. Winter quarter the seminar will meet several times, but not every week. Students will spend the quarter conducting research and producing a first draft of a 40-60 page research project based on primary sources. Spring quarter is spent revising the draft for a final version that will be due in May. Students will work with the 398 instructor and a thesis advisor who they
will pick in finding and defining their topic.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
AREA OF CONCENTRATION: The course serves all geographical areas of the department
PREREQUISITES: 3.5 GPA and admission to the seminar by application

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: TEACHING METHOD: Discussion and individual consultation

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: EVALUATION METHOD: Fall quarter's grade is based on class participation. The winter or spring grade depends on successful completion of the senior thesis as evaluated by advisor and 398 instructor
